meanings.definition: To move swiftly with a rushing sound.
meanings.sent1: The wind whooshed through the trees.
meanings.sent2: The car whooshed past us on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The whooshed sound of the rocket taking off made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: Time whooshed by like a speeding train.
meanings.sent5: The whooshed of the waterfall was both calming and invigorating.

meanings.definition: To pass or move quickly or suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The ball whooshed through the air and landed in the basket.
meanings.sent2: The train whooshed by the platform without stopping.
meanings.sent3: The whooshed arrival of the pizza delivery guy saved the day.
meanings.sent4: Excitement whooshed through the crowd as the concert began.
meanings.sent5: The whooshed of adrenaline as she jumped out of the plane was exhilarating.
